Haha.  I love how angry the lamers are because they don't understand Alcohol 120's media descriptor image.  You typically will always mount the MDF file associated with the MDS image when you mount it with Alcohol 120%.  If you're using something different, you will just directly mount the MDS image.  If you're still using Daemon Tools, which is a buggy piece of useless shit at best, try using Alcohol 52% or 120% instead to mount images.  It actually works..
I meant the load the MDS file associated with the MDF image, otherwise mount the MDS directly.  Haha. Whoops.
